intro: Coumarouna micrantha, commonly known as the small-fruited coumarouna, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
